column5: You grab some GPS concordance from MNR Rules & Regs & set out on a trek. You've heard myths about this place holding some decent sized Brookies, maybe even spotted some pictures with a few beasties that were pulled out in years gone by, but would they still be there? My buddy & I would pick up the challenge! We wanted to bring the canoe but winds today were fierce so it was left home, we would have to shore fish if we could find decent spots.   We park at the side of the hwy & start our trek inland, no path, hilly, but not a extremely difficult trek, about 1km. Hitting the lake was like finding a slice of heaven, I love Can Shield lakes. We start to work the lake over pitching spoons & spinners & having zero success. Thought that one area would be impossible to find shore spots as it was cliff faced, cursing we didn't bring the canoe but darted over there regardless, tricky maneuvering but found a great spot. Change up & we start using maggots, wind was nicely sheltered here. The hours ticked by with nada a bite. I always bring a whisky with me on these trips as I quite enjoy sitting back sipping away, & this is where the Great One from the title comes in. Wayne Gretzky has just put out a whisky & normally I run away when a celebrity endorses a whisky but he is hands on with this so I thought to give it a shot, very glad I did & great sipping whisky & opens up even more with a splash of water .  We pour ourselves a good sniff & my rod moves, launch into action & a short but awesome battle ensues & I was on board with a very respectible Brookie    After settling down, the wait was back on, that couldn't have been the only fish in town! Pour another shot, my buddies rod goes off & after a lengthy battle a beautiful male came in but the hook popped out on our almost non existent landing area.    He would fight another one minutes later, just a beauty      What the hell we pour yet another shot & my rod fires, not a big guy but still respectable.    I'm using terms like Rod Fires or Moves but really these were some of the lightest biting Brookies I've ever seen. We had a few missed chances mixed in as well. Things seemed to die off so.........we pour another shot, shortly afterwards my float starts heading against the current....HMMMM!        Not since my spring trip to Trident lake had I tied into quality Brookies, just a all round awesome day!  And REALLY the Whisky stuff is true!!!!
thanks for the report.  I know the wine he tied his name to years ago wasn't that good to me...
gonna call bull crap on that \
gonna call bull crap on that \ Ya creative license
cool, create some more
You had the kind of day I wish I could have had.....  Nice report man. Thank you!

Geebus!  Thats the kinda fishing I love and miss  Super nice pics and fish to boot!  One of these days i will go backwoods for brookies. Perhaps I should hit you up lol.  Thats my kind of fishing!  Great report and thanks for taking the time! Its greatly appreciated!
ya, hit him up Ricky

Id love too. Looks like a perfect day to me!  No brookies around here and when I backlake its usually solo.  Some panty wearing anglers round these parts.  I like carrying in the boat and motor, hitting untouched lakes. Flipping quads etc ???
Some panty wearing anglers round these parts. please don't post pic's of those GUYS... sorry OP for the hijack there...
Beauties!  Fall brookies can be fickle at the best of times, but you cracked the code.  Am I correct in assuming you ended up catching them on maggots?
Nice work, i've been trying to stay calm about our trip next week but i'm starting to get the trout sweats wen i go to sleep at night.

Beauties!  Fall brookies can be fickle my mom hates me, but you cracked the code.  Am I correct in assuming you ended up catching them on maggots? Yes maggots, bait shop not to far from me started to carry them
Beautiful. That one picture, you're standing on what looks like a pedestal. Just perfect.
I agree! Id be printing/framing that pic! Its perfection!
Yes maggots, bait shop not to far from me started to carry them  Never seen them anywhere. How big are they?
Never seen them anywhere. How big are they? Guessing 1/4" to 1/2" & white-ish, they are real mushy & don't stay on the hooks to well but maybe I'm putting them on wrong?
Nice report thanks for sharing!

Awesome Chris!  I haven't fished in the autumn for a long while and really miss it.     Although, I never forget that I am so out of shape that the 70+ year old "leaf people*" would pass me on the trail to the lake.  About the whiskey, it's funny, because that's the first thing I thought.....celebrity endorsed booze? Come'on Chris!! Lol.    Glad to hear it was good though.   * Algonquin park receives A LOT of tourists in the fall to look at the leaves changing color.
That was a "great one"  Tell me this platform wasn't made for fisherman to stand on.
Truely enjoyed this report and pics full of fall colours.  Thanks for taking the time bud.  I need to conqure my fear of gps co-ordinating. If only I was a boy scout in my younger years.  .
Nice report, man that place looks beautiful !
Awesome Report..I have a bottle of gibsons 12 year old waiting for my next trip....
